availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Thomas in Grant County, Kentucky, on March 10, 1835. Father of Mary Lucas, Moses Lucas, Stephen Lucas, Samuel Lucas, Maleta Lucas, Joseph Lucas, Sam Lucas, George Lucas, Juliette Lucas, and Smith Lucas. Farmer in Scott County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Farmer in Scott County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Scott County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 213A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Grant County Marriages, Film 000266220, p. 357.
